tasks.task: Setting up and maintaining a sustainable shrimp farm (Backyard shrimping)
subtasks: Obtaining a SAR grant for sustainable shrimp farming
Explaining the use of a biofilter for water chemical control
Describing the role of solar panels in powering pumps
Detailing water flow through the biofilter system
Identifying the pool as the primary water containment for shrimp
Describing the substrates used for shrimp growth (mesh-covered frames)
Describing the feeding schedule (twice daily, morning and afternoon)
Identifying the feed type (AquaMax 1000, high protein fish fry pellets)
Preparing a website (Backyardshrimping.com) with project details
Offering cost breakdown and time frame information for backyard farmers
Advising on the source and stocking of juvenile shrimp
Estimating the number of remaining shrimp (800) after 100 days
Anticipating shrimp sizes between number 18 to 14
Projecting the potential marketing appeal of all-natural raised shrimp

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Setting up and maintaining a sustainable shrimp farm (Backyard shrimping)
